intro: Ohigginsia verticillata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Ohigginsia verticillata thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, temperate climates.
